info.description: The API for Notifications provides endpoints that you can use to create and manage event notifications between third-party applications and the Red Hat Hybrid Cloud Console.
info.title: Notifications

post.description: Creates a behavior group that defines which notifications will be sent to external services after an event is received. Use this endpoint to control the types of events users are notified about.

get.description: Lists the behavior groups that are affected by the removal of an endpoint. Use this endpoint to understand how removing an endpoint affects existing behavior groups.
get.summary: List the behavior groups affected by the removal of an endpoint

put.description: Updates the list of actions to be executed in that particular behavior group after an event is received.

parameters.description: The UUID of the behavior group to update
parameters.name: behaviorGroupId

put.summary: Update the list of behavior group actions

delete.description: Deletes a behavior group and all of its configured actions. Use this endpoint when you no longer need a behavior group.

parameters.description: The UUID of the behavior group to delete
parameters.name: id

put.description: Updates the details of a behavior group. Use this endpoint to update the list of related endpoints and event types associated with this behavior group.

parameters.description: The UUID of the behavior group to update
parameters.name: id

404.description: No behavior group found with the passed id.

get.description: Lists the behavior groups associated with a bundle. Use this endpoint to see the behavior groups that are configured for a particular bundle for a particular tenant.

parameters.description: UUID of the bundle to retrieve the behavior groups for.
parameters.name: bundleId

get.summary: List behavior groups in a bundle

get.description: Retrieves the details of a bundle by searching by its name.

Retrieves an application by bundle and application names. Use this endpoint to  find an application by searching for the bundle that the application is part of. This is useful if you do not know the UUID of the bundle or application.
get.summary: Retrieve an application by bundle and application names

get.description: Retrieves the details of an event type by specifying the bundle name, the application name, and the event type name.
get.summary: Retrieve an event type by bundle, application and event type names

get.description: Allowed `sort_by` fields are `bundleIds`, `applicationIds`, `eventTypeIds`, `startTime`, `endTime` and `read`. The ordering can be optionally specified by appending `:asc` or `:desc` to the field, e.g. `bundle:desc`. Defaults to `desc` for the `created` field and to `asc` for all other fields.
Lists all event types. You can filter the returned list by bundle, application name, or unmuted types.
Lists the event types that will be affected by the removal of a behavior group. Use this endpoint to see which event types will be removed if you delete a behavior group.

parameters.description: The UUID of the behavior group to check
parameters.name: behaviorGroupId

get.summary: List the event types affected by the removal of a behavior group

get.description: Lists the behavior groups that are linked to an event type. Use this endpoint to see which behavior groups will be affected if you delete an event type.
get.summary: List the behavior groups linked to an event type

put.description: Updates the list of behavior groups associated with an event type.

parameters.description: UUID of the eventType to associate with the behavior group(s)
parameters.name: eventTypeId

put.summary: Update the list of behavior groups for an event type

delete.description: Delete a behavior group from the specified event type.
delete.summary: Delete a behavior group from an event type

put.description: Updates the list of endpoints associated with an event type.

parameters.description: UUID of the eventType to associate with the endpoint(s)
parameters.name: eventTypeId

put.summary: Update the list of endpoints for an event type
Add a behavior group to the given event type.

get.description: Retrieves the event log entries. Use this endpoint to review a full history of the events related to the tenant. You can sort by the bundle, application, event, and created fields. You can specify the sort order by appending :asc or :desc to the field, for example bundle:desc. Sorting defaults to desc for the created field and to asc for all other fields.
Returns a list of configured applications that includes the application name, the display name, and the ID. You can use this list to configure a filter in the UI.
Returns a list of configured bundles that includes the bundle name, the display name, and the ID. You can use this list to configure a filter in the UI.
Retrieves the daily digest time setting. Use this endpoint to check the time that daily emails are sent.

put.description: Sets the daily digest UTC time. The accepted minute values are 00, 15, 30, and 45. Use this endpoint to set the time when daily emails are sent.
